column4: hi, i need to install an epson cx5600 scanner, can somebody help me?
use the webrowser and localhost 631
use the webrowser and localhost:631
i beg your pardon?
wow
use the webrowser http://localhost:631/
ok, but i dont find any scanner option.
well you should go to your vendors webssite check support and see if they support linux with scanner also try googleing
i tried google, but the driver package is in rpm and i need it in .deb
i tried to converti it with alien, but it looks like it doesn't work in 64bits
hmm well you might be able to use alien and convert to .deb dunno, if so use the -s option with alien
that is probably so. 64bit operating systems dont have much support for stuff
use 32bit
yeah right, let me return my 64bits laptop xD
no, you miss understand, use the 32bit version of ubuntu
using 32bits for a 64bits architecture? =/
that is what i am doing right now
not much gain with 64bit at this point in time
pros & cons?
basically compatibilty, but if you are doing a server they say its a good thing but i have used 32bit for both, i just had too many bugs with 64bit
and printer drivers is one of the issues
ok... iÄºl keep looking
